name: Bridalveil Fall

trails.name: Bridalveil Fall Trail
trails.parking_info: Bridalveil Fall parking lot, direct access from valley. Very popular.

generated_description:
Bridalveil Fall is one of Yosemite's most iconic and accessible waterfalls, visible from many valley viewpoints and cascading 620 feet in a delicate veil-like stream. This incredibly short 0.5-mile round trip is perfect for all ages and abilities, including wheelchairs (though the final approach is steep and may require assistance).

In spring, Bridalveil roars with snowmelt and sprays mist over the entire viewing area. By late summer, the flow decreases to a gentle veil—hence the name. Either season offers unique beauty and photo opportunities of this Yosemite classic.

faqs.question: How long does it take to hike Bridalveil Fall?
faqs.answer: Only 15-30 minutes round trip! It's a 0.5-mile paved trail (0.25 miles each way) with minimal elevation gain. Most visitors spend more time at the viewpoint taking photos than actually hiking. Perfect for a quick Yosemite experience when time is limited.

faqs.question: Can I hike to the top of Bridalveil Fall?
faqs.answer: No established trail goes to the top of Bridalveil Fall. The official trail leads to a base viewing area only. There are unmaintained routes to the top but they're dangerous, unofficial, and not recommended. The base view is spectacular and safe.

warnings: Viewing area slippery when wet from spray
Final approach is steep—wheelchairs may need assistance
Winter ice can make trail hazardous
